title: Real-Time Word-Level Temporal Segmentation in Streaming Speech Recognition
author: Naoto Nishida (Institution), Hirotaka Hiraki (Institution), Jun Rekimoto (Institution), Yoshio Ishiguro (Institution), ...
relevance_why: The paper addresses a significant challenge in real-time captioning by introducing dynamic word-level text decorations based on speech characteristics, which could enhance the auditory accessibility in speech applications relevant to Haohe's work.
background: Developing a system that segments streaming speech recognition results into words and enhances text by dynamically adjusting attributes according to auditory cues.
contribution: This paper introduces a real-time rich-text captioning system to solve the problem of conveying speaker intent through dynamic text attributes, achieving more engaging communication for diverse users.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous real-time captioning systems lack the capability to modify text attributes dynamically based on speech characteristics.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work utilizes a continuous audio analysis approach to adjust word-level text attributes in real-time, improving user engagement and the conveyance of speaker intent.

key_innovation: The method uniquely combines real-time speech segmentation with immediate visual text adjustments based on paralinguistic cues like loudness and emphasis.
real_world_impact: The approach has the potential to significantly improve accessibility for Deaf, hard-of-hearing individuals, and second-language learners, enhancing how they interact with multimedia content.
limitations: Challenges include computational efficiency in the integration of over-segmented parts and the need for further improvements in positioning timing accuracy.

new_terms.paralinguistic cues: **Paralinguistic cues** refer to features of spoken communication that convey meaning beyond the words spoken, such as intonation, tone, and loudness.
new_terms.rich-text captions: **Rich-text captions** are enhanced text representations that include varied attributes like font size and style to capture the nuances of spoken language.
